name: Perl
title: The perl quick reference cheat sheet that aims at providing help on writing basic syntax and methods.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: The perl quick reference cheat sheet that aims at providing help on writing basic syntax and methods.

cards.title: Unix and Linux Installation
cards.body: • Open a Web browser and go to https://www.perl.org/get.html.

cards.title: Unix and Linux Installation
cards.body: • Follow the link to download zipped source code available for Unix/Linux.

cards.title: Unix and Linux Installation
cards.body: • Download perl-5.x.y.tar.gz file and issue the following commands at $ prompt.

cards.title: Unix and Linux Installation
cards.code:
$tar -xzf perl-5.x.y.tar.gz
$cd perl-5.x.y
$./Configure -de
$make
$make test
$make install

cards.title: Windows Installation
cards.body: • Follow the link for the Strawberry Perl installation on Windows http://strawberryperl.com

cards.title: Windows Installation
cards.body: • Download either 32bit or 64bit version of installation.

cards.title: Windows Installation
cards.body: • Run the downloaded file by double-clicking it in Windows Explorer. This brings up the Perl install wizard, which is

cards.title: Windows Installation
cards.body:
really easy to use. Just accept the default settings, wait until the installation is finished, and you're ready to
roll!

cards.title: Macintosh Installation
cards.body: • Open a Web browser and go to https://www.perl.org/get.html.

cards.title: Macintosh Installation
cards.body: • Follow the link to download zipped source code available for Mac OS X.

cards.title: Macintosh Installation
cards.body: • Download perl-5.x.y.tar.gz file and issue the following commands at $ prompt

cards.title: Macintosh Installation
cards.code:
$tar -xzf perl-5.x.y.tar.gz
$cd perl-5.x.y
$./Configure -de
$make
$make test
$make install

cards.title: Running Perl
cards.code:
# Unix/Linux
$perl  -e <perl code>
# Windows/DOS
C:>perl -e <perl code>

cards.code:

# Windows/DOS
C:>perl script.pl

cards.title: First Perl Program
cards.code:
$perl -e 'print "Hello World\n"'

# #!/usr/bin/perl

# This will print "Hello, World"
print "Hello, world\n";
$chmod 0755 hello.pl
$./hello.pl
